column9: Do you believe that pandemic Covid-19 exists in your area?
column10: What is your firm belief about Covid-19?
column11: In your opinion what is the best way to avoid /fight the pandemic?
column12: On a scale of 1-5 (where 1 is highly affected and 5 is not affected) how much do you think your family and livelihoods are affected by covid-19 pandemic problem?
column13: Which of the following are the symptoms of Covid-19?
column14: In case you feel any of the above symptoms what will be your first reaction
column15: Which of the following statements do you agree with?
column16: In your opinion what kind of information regarding Covid-19 is most reliable and should be followed most?
column17: Do you think women are most vulnerable to the issues and risks associated with Covid-19 and its social and economic impacts?
column18: Do you know about official government helpline numbers to get CovidOVID-19 related information and support?
column19: On a scale of 1-5 how accessible are government services and facilities on covid-19 for you?
column20: In your opinion, how should government support citizens to fight against coronavirus?
column21: In your opinion, what role can you play in fighting Coronavirus?
column22: Which of the following preventive measures do you follow to keep yourself and your family safe from contracting the virus?
column23: If the government runs a Coronavirus vaccination campaign in your district, would you immunize yourself?
column24: Do you find too much fake news, rumors, and misinformation on Covid-19 circulating in your community?
column25: Do you think that local community awareness programs on Covid-19 can help build better community response against the pandemic?
